name: Learn Python
description: Programming fundamentals for researchers — data manipulation, visualization, and workflows

resources.name: Coding for practitioners
resources.why: Built specifically for econ researchers

resources.name: The Missing Semester (MIT)
resources.why: Git, shell, debugging — skills they don't teach in PhD programs

resources.name: Python for Econometrics
resources.why: NumPy, pandas, statsmodels from Kevin Sheppard

resources.name: Python Data Science Handbook
resources.why: Free reference for NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib

name: Learn Statistics
description: Hypothesis testing, inference, and distributions — the foundation for empirical work

resources.name: StatQuest (Josh Starmer)
resources.why: Visual intuition for stats — the 'Bill Nye of Statistics'

resources.name: Seeing Theory (Brown)
resources.why: Beautiful interactive visualizations for building intuition

resources.name: Think Stats
resources.why: Programming-first approach with real datasets

resources.name: Scipy.stats Documentation
resources.why: Reference for distributions and tests

packages.name: pingouin
packages.why: ANOVA, t-tests, and correlations made easy

name: Learn ML
description: Prediction, tree models, and cross-validation — for forecasting and pattern recognition

resources.name: Introduction to Statistical Learning
resources.why: Free, runnable Python code, intuition first

resources.name: Google ML Crash Course
resources.why: 130+ interactive exercises, refreshed 2024

resources.name: Hands-On Machine Learning (Géron)
resources.why: Production-focused, complements ISLR's statistical focus

resources.name: fast.ai Practical Deep Learning
resources.why: Code first, theory second

resources.name: Andrew Ng's ML Specialization
resources.why: The classic introduction, rebuilt 2022 with Python

resources.name: Andrew Ng's Deep Learning Specialization
resources.why: CNNs, RNNs, and transformers from the master

packages.name: scikit-learn
packages.why: The go-to library for classical ML

name: Learn Causal Inference
description: Treatment effects, DiD, RDD, and IV — answer 'what if' questions with data

resources.name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
resources.why: The best free intro with Python code

resources.name: The Effect
resources.why: DAGs that don't suck, readable and modern

resources.name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
resources.why: Reads like a conversation, not a textbook

name: Learn Product Sense
description: PM thinking, metrics selection, and product strategy — build intuition for what to build and why

resources.name: Ken Norton: How to Hire a PM
resources.why: Defines what a PM does by revealing hiring criteria — the map of competencies to develop

resources.name: SVPG: Product Management Start Here
resources.why: Distinguishes 'empowered teams' from 'feature teams' — exposes PM theater

resources.name: Shreyas Doshi: LNO Framework
resources.why: Leverage, Neutral, Overhead prioritization — breakthrough model from Stripe/Google

resources.name: Intercom: RICE + Product Management Book
resources.why: The RICE framework (Reach, Impact, Confidence, Effort) originated here — industry standard

resources.name: Gibson Biddle: DHM Strategy Framework
resources.why: 13-essay series on how Netflix built product strategy — case study depth

resources.name: Teresa Torres: Opportunity Solution Trees
resources.why: Connects outcomes → opportunities → solutions → experiments with visual rigor

resources.name: Marty Cagan: INSPIRED
resources.why: THE definitive PM book — empowered teams, discovery vs delivery, how Amazon/Google operate

resources.name: Atlassian: How to Write Product Requirements
resources.why: Practical PRD guide with templates — from the makers of Jira

resources.name: Amplitude: Product Lessons with Shreyas Doshi
resources.why: Deep dive on 'Impact, Execution, Optics' — how metrics connect to strategy

resources.name: Lenny's Newsletter & Podcast
resources.why: 700k+ subscribers, interviews with world-class PMs — the ongoing 'product sense' resource

packages.name: Amplitude
packages.why: Product analytics — funnels, retention, user journeys

packages.name: Mixpanel
packages.why: User behavior analytics — event tracking and cohorts

packages.name: Heap
packages.why: Autocapture analytics — retroactive analysis without instrumentation

name: Learn Experimentation
description: A/B testing, power analysis, and statistical rigor — bridge your training to industry experiments

resources.name: Trustworthy Online Controlled Experiments (Kohavi)
resources.why: THE 400-page industry bible — Kohavi (Microsoft), Tang (Google), Xu (LinkedIn)

resources.name: Spotify: Choosing Sequential Testing Framework
resources.why: GST vs mSPRT vs GAVI — production comparison with simulations

resources.name: Always Valid Inference (Johari et al.)
resources.why: Foundational paper solving the 'peeking problem' — Stanford + Optimizely

resources.name: Understanding CUPED (Matteo Courthoud)
resources.why: Most accessible CUPED explanation — derives variance reduction math clearly

resources.name: Airbnb: Variance Reduction Using In-Experiment Data
resources.why: Extends CUPED for delayed outcomes — real booking flow examples (KDD 2023)

resources.name: Netflix Tech Blog: Experimentation Series
resources.why: Platform architecture, sequential testing, contextual bandits at scale

resources.name: Uber: Supercharging A/B Testing
resources.why: Rebuilding experimentation from ground-up — 1,000+ concurrent experiments

resources.name: LinkedIn: A/B Testing Platform Technical Paper
resources.why: 41,000+ simultaneous tests on 700M members — network-specific challenges

resources.name: Reducing Interference Bias (Holtz et al.)
resources.why: Proves standard A/B can overstate effects 100% in marketplaces — Management Science

resources.name: Evan Miller's A/B Testing Tools
resources.why: Best-in-class interactive calculators — understand stats under the hood

resources.name: 150 Successful ML Models (Booking.com)
resources.why: Model performance ≠ business performance — why RCTs matter for ML (KDD 2019)

resources.name: Stitch Fix: Multi-Armed Bandits Integration
resources.why: Thompson Sampling vs ε-greedy in production — practical tradeoffs explained

packages.name: GrowthBook SDK
packages.why: Feature flags and experiments — open source

packages.name: Ax
packages.why: Meta's adaptive experimentation platform — Bayesian optimization

name: Learn SQL

resources.name: SQLBolt

resources.name: Mode SQL Tutorial
resources.why: Interactive lessons with real database

resources.name: SELECT Star SQL
resources.why: Interactive book teaching SQL through meaningful analysis

resources.name: 8 Week SQL Challenge (Danny Ma)
resources.why: 8 business case studies with CTEs and window functions

resources.name: DataLemur
resources.why: Real DS interview questions with business context

packages.name: duckdb
packages.why: Modern SQL on your laptop, reads Parquet

resources.name: Scrapy Documentation

name: Learn Optimization (OR)
description: Linear programming, convex optimization, and combinatorial methods — solve pricing, scheduling, and allocation problems

resources.name: MIT 15.053: Optimization Methods
resources.why: Beginner-friendly LP — geometry and visualization before algebra

resources.name: QuantEcon: Linear Programming
resources.why: Python notebooks from Nobel Laureate Sargent — economics applications

resources.name: Stanford CS229 Convex Overview
resources.why: The ideal pre-Boyd prep — intuition before rigor

resources.name: Convex Optimization (Boyd & Vandenberghe)
resources.why: The bible — free online, universally cited

resources.name: Stanford EE364A (YouTube)
resources.why: Boyd's legendary lectures — the gold standard

resources.name: CVXPY Short Course
resources.why: Hands-on convex optimization in Python — from Boyd's group

resources.name: Real Python: Linear Programming
resources.why: SciPy and PuLP with clear explanations — includes MIP

resources.name: DoorDash: ML + Optimization for Dispatch
resources.why: Real-world DeepRed system — ML estimation + MIP matching

resources.name: Discrete Optimization (Coursera)
resources.why: Van Hentenryck's course — actually makes you implement

packages.name: cvxpy
packages.why: Write math as code — the standard for convex problems

packages.name: scipy.optimize

name: Learn Forecasting
description: Time series analysis, demand forecasting, and prediction — ARIMA, Prophet, and modern ML methods for business planning

resources.name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice (Python)
resources.why: THE definitive resource — Hyndman's book with Nixtla Python code

resources.name: MIT 14.384: Time Series Analysis
resources.why: Graduate-level — ARMA, VAR, cointegration, Kalman filters

resources.name: statsforecast Documentation
resources.why: Nixtla's AutoARIMA — 19x faster than pmdarima

resources.name: Prophet Critique (Sean Taylor)
resources.why: Must-read from Prophet co-creator — honest limitations

resources.name: Uber: Forecasting Introduction
resources.why: ARIMA, Holt-Winters, Theta — insights from M4 winner Smyl

resources.name: DoorDash: ELITE Ensemble Learning
resources.why: Accuracy vs compute tradeoffs — Ray for distributed forecasting

resources.name: Amazon: Chronos Foundation Model
resources.why: Zero-shot forecasting with T5 architecture — state of the art

resources.name: sktime: Unified Framework
resources.why: scikit-learn API for time series — NeurIPS paper

resources.why: Free graduate course — ARIMA, spectral analysis, ARCH/GARCH
